title: Jameela Jamil scolded 'incredibly rude' diplomats who were talking over the speakers at a UN women's conference
text:
"The Good Place" star Jameela Jamil, who's also an activist and advocate for body positivity, started her speech at the WE Day UN event in New York on Wednesday with an "absolute bollocking" for audience members who were talking over the speakers.

"Hi, sorry, can we get the people in the back to stop talking?" Jamil demanded in the speech shared on Twitter.

"Can you just be quiet because this is a night in which we're honoring incredible women and frankly, I think women have been spoken over for long enough," she said to rapturous applause from the crowd.

"It's incredibly rude," she added.

Watch the moment below:

Later that day, Jamil told Jimmy Fallon on NBC's "The Tonight Show" that people talking during concerts and speaking events was one of her biggest pet peeves.

"I shouted at diplomats and world leaders at the back who were talking over the amazing women who were being celebrated on stage," she told the host.

"I really don't like it!"
